page.title: 19Home Life in Melchbourne
page.content: The twelve working households in Melchbourne are of necessity two car families. One particular housewife drives 280 miles a week, taking children to and from school and their various activities and doing the weekly shopping. This particular family moved into the village 3 years ago and concentrated all their efforts into restoring their old farmhouse to its original state, taking great care to maintain its charm and character. The old bread oven was discovered whilst replastering and the original kitchen floor tiles were removed and carefully replaced after damproofing. The warmth of this timber framed building is reflected in the happiness of the family and the scene of children playing, the pet ducks contemplating their pond. Idyllic.
